intro: Anisomeles indica var. biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered Indian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a striking addition to gardens and green spaces.
